techmeme.title: Starting September 1, schools in Beijing will offer at least eight hours of AI classes per academic year for primary and secondary students (Bloomberg)
Zoom researchers detail a "chain of draft" method to let LLMs accurately solve reasoning problems with as little as 7.6% of the tokens used by current methods (Michael Nuñez/VentureBeat)
NYC-based Firsthand, whose tools let marketers and publishers engage consumers through AI agents on their own sites or other sites, raised a $26M Series A (Kerry Flynn/Axios)
Tarlogic researchers find an undocumented "backdoor" in Chinese manufacturer Espressif's ESP32 microchip used in 1B+ devices for WiFi and Bluetooth connectivity (Bill Toulas/BleepingComputer)
A US federal judge allows the Kadrey v. Meta case, in which authors allege Meta violated IP rights by using their books to train Llama models, to move forward (Anthony Ha/TechCrunch)
